Address.college_name: Cracow University of Technology
Address.university_name: Politechnika Krakowska im. Tadeusza Kościuszki (PK, CUT)

GeneralInformation.History:
Founded 1945.Cracow University of Technology is one of the best technical universities in Poland
The Faculty of Civil Engineering and Faculty of Architecture are accredited by the European Network for Accreditation of Engineering Education. Moreover the Faculty of Architecture is accredited by the Royal Institute of British Architects and the International Federation of Landscape Architects (IFLA) Europe. Cracow University of Technology was awarded the Logo Human Resources Excellence in Research by the European Commission. Our university cooperates with more than 160 international universities and institutes from 53 countries. You will find information on our partners on http://iro.pk.edu.pl/international-cooperation/. We offer English-taught courses (http://iro.pk.edu.pl/incoming-exchange-students/) as well as bachelor (http://iro.pk.edu.pl/bachelors-degree/) and master (http://iro.pk.edu.pl/masters-degree/) programmes.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Matura) and entrance examination

Address.college_name: Jagiellonian University in Kraków
Address.university_name: Uniwersytet Jagielloński w Krakowie (UJ)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1364 by Casimir the Great on the model of the universities of Padua and Bologna. Reorganized 1400 by Ladislaus Jagiello on the pattern of the Sorbonne. Copernicus studied at the university in the 15th century. Reorganized in the 19th century in keeping with the ideas of rationalism. University closed and nearly two hundred professors were deported during the German occupation 1939. Operated as an underground university with 800 students after 1942. Extensive reconstruction began after 1945. Acquired present status and title 1964.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Matura) and entrance examination

Divisions.College: Innovations Technology Transfer and University Development
Physics, Astronomy and Applied Computer Science
American Studies and Polish Diaspora, TransAtlantic Studies

Divisions.Details: Interfaculty, Physical Education and Sports Studium

Address.college_name: State Higher Vocational School in Elbląg
Address.university_name: Państwowa Wyższa Szkoła Zawodowa w Elblągu – The State University of Applied Sciences (PWSZ) in Elbląg (PWSZ w Elblągu)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1998. The State University of Applied Sciences in Elbląg is the first independent higher education institution in the post-war history of the city, but the history of higher education in Elbląg goes back to 1954, when Technical University of Gdańsk opened in Elbląg its Consultation Office, which was transformed into the Elbląg Branch of Gdańsk Polytechnic in 1969. In 1991, in co-operation with Gdańsk University, a Teacher Training College and Foreign Languages Teacher Training College were founded, offering B.A. courses. These three institutions constituted the basis for founding the State Higher Vocational School in Elbląg in 1998. It was established on the basis of higher school of vocational education act from the 26. of June 1997 and ministerial regulation from the 16. of June 1998.
